name: AzureEventhubs
help: Manage Azure Event Hubs namespaces, eventhubs, consumergroups and geo recovery configurations - Alias.

properties.name: Alias
properties.help: Name of Geo-Disaster Recovery Configuration Alias.

properties.name: PartnerNamespace
properties.help: Name (if within the same resource group) or ARM Id of the Primary/Secondary eventhub namespace name, which is part of GEO DR pairing.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: AlternateName
properties.help: Alternate Name for the Alias, when the Namespace name and Alias name are same.

properties.name: Alias
properties.help: Name of Geo-Disaster Recovery Configuration Alias.

properties.name: Capacity
properties.help: Capacity for Sku.

properties.name: EnableAutoInflate
properties.help: A boolean value that indicates whether AutoInflate is enabled for eventhub namespace.

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=&lt;location&gt;`.

properties.name: MaximumThroughputUnits
properties.help: Upper limit of throughput units when AutoInflate is enabled, vaule should be within 0 to 20 throughput units. ( 0 if AutoInflateEnabled = true).

properties.name: Tags
properties.help: Space-separated tags in 'key[=value]' format. Use "" to clear existing tags.

properties.name: Capacity

properties.name: EnableAutoInflate
properties.help: A boolean value that indicates whether AutoInflate is enabled for eventhub namespace.

properties.name: MaximumThroughputUnits
properties.help: Upper limit of throughput units when AutoInflate is enabled, vaule should be within 0 to 20 throughput units. ( 0 if AutoInflateEnabled = true).

properties.name: Tags
properties.help: Space-separated tags in 'key[=value]' format. Use "" to clear existing tags.

properties.name: Add
properties.help: Add an object to a list of objects by specifying a path and key value pairs.  Example: --add property.listProperty <key=value, string or JSON string>.

properties.name: ForceString
properties.help: When using 'set' or 'add', preserve string literals instead of attempting to convert to JSON.

properties.name: Remove
properties.help: Remove a property or an element from a list.  Example: --remove property.list <indexToRemove> OR --remove propertyToRemove.

properties.name: Set
properties.help: Update an object by specifying a property path and value to set.  Example: --set property1.property2=<value>.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of Eventhub.

properties.name: NamespaceName
properties.help: Name of Namespace.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: EnableCapture
properties.help: A boolean value that indicates whether capture description is enabled.

properties.name: MessageRetention
properties.help: Number of days to retain events for this Event Hub, value should be 1 to 7 days.

properties.name: PartitionCount
properties.help: Number of partitions created for the Event Hub. By default, allowed values are 2-32. Lower value of 1 is supported with Kafka enabled namespaces. In presence of a custom quota, the upper limit will match the upper limit of the quota.

properties.name: Status
properties.help: Status of Eventhub.

properties.name: CaptureInterval
properties.help: Allows you to set the frequency with which the capture to Azure Blobs will happen, value should between 60 to 900 seconds.

properties.name: CaptureSizeLimit
properties.help: Defines the amount of data built up in your Event Hub before an capture operation, value should be between 10485760 to 524288000 bytes.

properties.name: ArchiveNameFormat
properties.help: Blob naming convention for archive, e.g. {Namespace}/{EventHub}/{PartitionId}/{Year}/{Month}/{Day}/{Hour}/{Minute}/{Second}. Here all the parameters (Namespace,EventHub .. etc) are mandatory irrespective of order.

properties.name: BlobContainer
properties.help: Blob container Name.

properties.name: DestinationName
properties.help: Name for capture destination.

properties.name: StorageAccount
properties.help: Name (if within same resource group and not of type Classic Storage) or ARM id of the storage account to be used to create the blobs.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of Eventhub.

properties.name: NamespaceName
properties.help: Name of Namespace.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: NamespaceName
properties.help: Name of Namespace.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Skip
properties.help: Skip is only used if a previous operation returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a skip parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

properties.name: Top
properties.help: May be used to limit the number of results to the most recent N usageDetails.

properties.name: UserMetadata
properties.help: Usermetadata is a placeholder to store user-defined string data with maximum length 1024. e.g. it can be used to store descriptive data, such as list of teams and their contact information also user-defined configuration settings can be stored.
